content.content: Hey guys! December has been chart month at makerburn.com and the site has become even more graphic. Here’s a bunch of stuff that changed this past month!  Dashboard charts  image952×491 69.9 KB  Dashboard numbers now have accompanying background charts that shows their recent development. This’ll hopefully help give a sense of each value’s recent momentum better than just the 24h change.  Burn auctions Makerburn loves burns (obviously), so a bunch of features have been added to visualize the process now that the burner has been properly reignited.  image928×170 16.1 KB  Running surplus (flap) auctions now appears on top of the burn page with an instruction on how to participate.  image930×285 21.3 KB  A settlement price chart shows historic settlement prices for auctions. Prices below whatever current market price is at the time of viewing have a teal colour (appologies to all my colour blind friends).  image938×278 21 KB  The slippage chart shows how much above or below market we are paying when burning MKR. Auctions that went below market are coloured purple (once again appologies to all my colour blind friends).  Liquidations  image938×252 8.9 KB  A new chart visualizes recent liquidations. That one 8.4M ETH A liquidation really stands out!  Treasury page  image1320×665 62.9 KB  A new treasury page shows assets currently controlled by the DAO.  image1338×663 76.3 KB  Each asset may be clicked or tapped to show that specific asset’s history.  Dashboard alerts  image916×132 16.3 KB  A new card displays a countdown for when the latest executive spell may be triggered.  image914×94 10.4 KB  Another card informs whenever there are active surplus auctions to look at.  Makerburnbot upgrades  Upgrades are being made continuously to Makerburnbot as well. For instance, the bot will now post burn auction offers as they are made and make a note when executive spells are triggered. Check it out in the #bot-feed discord channel.  Other stuff Various minor changes and visual improvements are always being made, so remember to check back from time to time. As always, if there is something you’d like to see changed or added, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thank you for using the site and I hope you all enjoy the upcoming holidays

Thank you sooo much for your website! I love DeFi and the idea of giving everyone in the world financial equality but if I’m honest my favourite thing about MakerDAO is the BURN  Your website inspires me every day and I hope you know how much joy you bring to MKR holders all around the world. TY bro!

Hi gang! Here’s a bunch of stuff that’s changed or added to https://makerburn.com this past month. Stablecoin ratio DAI from stablecoins (PSM, DAI/USDC LPs etc.) divided by DAI from non-stables (ETH, WTC, RWAs etc.). Ratio currently at ~1.35, down from a top of 1.89, means we’re moving towards most DAI being backed by non-stables once again.  stablecoin_ratio1317×789 50.8 KB  Total value locked (TVL) added to main dashboard Value calculated by using tokens locked and medianizer price meaning that there is at least some delay.  tvl924×194 32.5 KB  Profit estimate 24h change Also renamed card to “anual prodfit estimate”. Imagine if this kept increasing by several percentage points daily over time.  Custom sorting of collaterals It’s now possible to sort the collateral list by clicking on the column headers. Click twice to reverse the order.  sortable_collaterals956×286 33.3 KB  Notification bubbles Notification bubbles makes it easy to notice whenever there are open liquidations to keep an eye on.  Clickable protocol expenses You can now click on Core Unit names or DAI amounts on the protocol expenses page. Click the DAI amount to view the transaction on Etherescan, or…  clickable_transactions898×237 46.9 KB  …click the Core Unit name to enable a filtering of that specific CU.  expenses_filter1092×476 44.9 KB  Makerburn Moments Makerburn Moments is a small collection of NFTs celebrating milestones and historic events of MakerDAO as viewed through Makerburn. Have a look here.  makerburn_moments_nfts929×486 48.8 KB  As always, if there is something you’d like to see changed or added, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thank you all for using the site
Thoughts on using the OSM price vs the Medianizer price for the TVL calculation?
Don’t think it matters all that much, but I had the same thought and already replaced OSM with Medianizer
Wow, I’m always blown away by the quality and attention to detail. Wen Makerburn CU?
Always like Makerburn I was looking at the DAI supply chart, all parameters but stablecoin ratio have the unit of Billions, but the ratio is not. So it would be nice to have a y2-axis on that?
We say in my country, that when things are done with desire and passion it shows in the result, congratulations team, very good work.
Congratulations to all the team, you can really see the love they put in the web. I hope to be able to buy a nft I love the moments.

Hey all! Here’s a bunch of stuff that’s changed or added to makerburn.com this past month. Debt ceilings I’ve spent a lot of time lately trying to put more focus on debt ceilings and our tendency to hit them, stopping growth - not only through updates to makerburn, but also here on the forum (1, 2). To that end, I’ve also created a warning on the makerburn dashboard.  2021-11-08_14-47904×139 14.9 KB  A click or tap on this warning will take you to the collateral list where a “capped” filter is pre-applied to single out the relevant collateral(s).  2021-11-08_14-47_1971×201 24.9 KB  This filter may also be applied manually, and there is an option for “maxed” collaterals as well.  2021-11-08_14-48965×377 39.8 KB  There is also a warning on collateral detail pages.  And a new link to @lollike’s web app in case you want to help out and trigger a DC increase yourself. Colouration shows when this is possible or critical.  2021-11-08_14-53_1934×149 12.1 KB  New collateralization doughnut A new doughnut chart on the bottom of the collateral list page show how much DAI is generated from each type of collateral. ETH, for example, in this case counts the generated DAI total from ETH-A, ETH-B and ETH-C. Note that this chart has filters from the above list applied, so it won’t necessarily show data for the entire system.  2021-11-08_14-53885×346 36.1 KB  Chart option for P/E estimate Default selection also changed to profit estimate, P/E estimate (price over earnings) and fee income.  2021-11-08_15-231321×804 45.8 KB  MakerDAO growth page In case you’ve ever wondered how MakerDAO is growing but don’t want to read a chart, Makerburn’s got you covered. Only 9x growth in DAI supply this past year when the year prior it grew by 10x. Woe is us .  2021-11-08_14-59906×484 66 KB  D3M support Support for the cool new Aave Direct Depost Module (D3M) has been implemented. The “unclaimed interest” counter accrues live based on the current apy of DAI deposits on Aave.  2021-11-08_15-291190×652 63.4 KB  And finally… Introducing Makerburnbot  Makerburnbot does his best to provide Discord users with cool updates as they happen.  Right now, he will post when large mints happen, when MKR is burned or when new liquidations are triggered. A “large mint” means that the amount of DAI generated exceeds 0.05% of the total system supply (4.33M DAI at this moment when total supply is at 8.67B) or 1% of that collateral’s supply (for example 1.5M for ETH-B which is at 150M). Do you think the bot is too spammy? Maybe it should have a lower limit of 1M for new mints? Or maybe you’d even like to see more updates? Let me know in the comments! Other stuff There has also been a lot of minor improvements, like a 2 year duration option for the chart, but I think this post is already long enough. As always, if there is something you’d like to see changed or added, please don’t hesitate to reach out. Thank you all for using the site
Amazing as always! One of the few Dai trackers that’s a daily must check.

Absolutely killing it! I think having a lower limit of $1M on the bot would be great. I’m not sure if this would already be captured by the bot, but seeing when the first Dai is drawn from a new vault would also be super cool.
First mint of any vault type ignores the 1% lower limit
I use your tool everyday to check on Maker’s progress. Really appreciate all the features and frequent improvements. Keep it up!

makerburn:  Makerburnbot does his best to provide Discord users with cool updates as they happen.   Awesome work as always! And love the Makerburnbot. It seems like there had been several very large single vaults that generated more than 100m DAI at once during October. Do we have any insights on the customer demography?

Love the Revenue & Profit charts. One more plug for an “Annualized profit per coin” chart — given Makerburn’s emphasis on burning, I think it would be nice to see that number grow over time through burns as well as profit increases. I know that “Annualized profit per coin” would be very similar to the current “Annual profit estimate”, but the latter lacks a measure of how many coins are extant. “Annualized profit per coin” would also be related/similar to the current “P/E estimate”, but the latter includes prices swings in MKR which muddies the EPS. Thanks again!!
